RDA_R1_01M.description: The indicator concerns the quantity but also the quality of metadata provided in order to enhance data reusability

evidence.success: Plurality of accurate and relevant attributes are provided to allow reuse
evidence.failure: Plurality of accurate and relevant attributes are not provided to allow reuse

RDA_R1_01M.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_R1_01M.hint: Depending on the metadata schema used, checks that at least the mandatory terms are filled (75%) and the number of terms are high (25%)

RDA_R1_1_01M.description: This indicator is about the information that is provided in the metadata related to the conditions (e.g. obligations, restrictions) under which data can be reused

evidence.success: Metadata includes information about the licence under which the data can be reused
evidence.failure: Metadata does not include information about the licence under which the data can be reused

RDA_R1_1_01M.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_R1_1_01M.hint: Checks if the license information is available in any format

RDA_R1_1_02M.description: This indicator requires the reference to the conditions of reuse to be a standard licence, rather than a locally defined licence

evidence.success: Metadata refers to a standard reuse licence
evidence.failure: Metadata does not refer to a standard reuse licence

RDA_R1_1_02M.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_R1_1_02M.hint: Checks the presence of license information in metadata and if it is included in the list https://spdx.org/licenses/licenses.json

RDA_R1_1_03M.description: This indicator is about the way that the reuse licence is expressed. Rather than being a human-readable text, the licence should be expressed in such a way that it can be processed by machines, without human intervention

evidence.success: Metadata refers to a machine-understandable reuse licence
evidence.failure: Metadata does not refer to a machine-understandable reuse licence

RDA_R1_1_03M.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_R1_1_03M.hint: Checks the presence of license information in metadata and if it uses an id from the list https://spdx.org/licenses/licenses.json

RDA_R1_2_01M.description: This indicator requires the metadata to include information about the provenance of the data, i.e. information about the origin, history or workflow that generated the data, in a way that is compliant with the standards that are used in the community for which the data is curated

evidence.success: Metadata includes provenance information according to community-specific standards
evidence.failure: Metadata does not include provenance information according to community-specific standards

RDA_R1_2_01M.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_R1_2_01M.hint: To be defined (By default, DSpace all items record automatically the metadata dc.description.provenance of date, person and bitestream of the deposit. On the other hand, the description of the digital object might give more information about its origin, e.g. specifying creation date (dc.date.created), methodology (dc.description), and relationships with other objects (dc.relation).

RDA_R1_2_02M.description: This indicator requires that the metadata provides provenance information according to a cross-domain language

evidence.success: Metadata includes provenance information according to a cross-community language
evidence.failure: Metadata does not include provenance information according to a cross-community language

RDA_R1_2_02M.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_R1_2_02M.hint: This test implements the one carried out in RDA-R1.2-01M. It can be redefined by the plugin.

RDA_R1_3_01M.description: This indicator requires that metadata complies with community standards

evidence.success: Metadata complies with a community standard
evidence.failure: Metadata does not comply with a community standard

RDA_R1_3_01M.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_R1_3_01M.hint: Checks metadata formats for a specific community. For a generic service, Dublin Core as metadata standard for multi-domain repositories

RDA_R1_3_01D.description: This indicator requires that data complies with community standards

evidence.success: Data complies with a community standard
evidence.failure: Data does not comply with a community standard

RDA_R1_3_01D.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_R1_3_01D.hint: This test implements the one carried out in RDA-R1-01D. It can be redefined by the plugin.

RDA_R1_3_02M.description: This indicator requires that the metadata follows a community standard that has a machine-understandable expression

evidence.success: Metadata is expressed in compliance with a machine-understandable community standard
evidence.failure: Metadata is not expressed in compliance with a machine-understandable community standard

RDA_R1_3_02M.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_R1_3_02M.hint: Checks if metadata is described using any machine format like XML or RDF schema

RDA_R1_3_02D.description: This indicator requires that the data follows a community standard that has a machine-understandable expression

evidence.success: Data is expressed in compliance with a machine-understandable community standard
evidence.failure: Data is not expressed in compliance with a machine-understandable community standard

RDA_R1_3_02D.info:
More details on RDA Maturity Model specification

.
RDA_R1_3_02D.hint: This test implements the one carried out in RDA-R1-01D. It can be redefined by the plugin.
